com.google.development.leonmerten.pattern.commons.countdown

Class Countdown

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.development.leonmerten.pattern.commons.countdown.Countdown

  • public class Countdown
extends java.lang.Object

    Start a Countdown

    Using the Countdown class you can run the countdown specified in the upper class: CountdownBuilder

    It allows you to start, stop and reset the countdown.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
         throws IllegalMethodUsageException

        Start the Countdown

        Using this method you can start the countdown instance. If its already running an exception is being thrown. The method will process inside of a new thread. It is prohibited to access this thread. The thread will die if number t is larger than the remaining time. If there is a Delegate that will trigger every second declared in countdownBuilder it will be called. After that it checks if theres a tick set. Using the tick set you can call a Delegate only in specific times.
        Throws:
        IllegalMethodUsageException - this exception is being thrown if the countdown instance is already running

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the countdown. Parameters are still the same.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Basicly just calls stop() and dosn't do much more TODO: ADD MORE LOGIC (kappa)

      • isRunning

        public boolean isRunning()
        This method is being used to check if the countdown of this class is running
        Returns:
        local variable running
